definition[0]: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation
example[0]: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
example[1]: The children are finding it hard to adapt to the new school.
example[2]: flowers which are well adapted to harsh winters
example[3]: How do these insects adapt themselves to new environments?
definition[1]: to change something to make it suitable for a different purpose
example[4]: The car has been adapted to take unleaded gas.
example[5]: These teaching materials can be adapted for older children.
definition[2]: if a book or play is adapted for film, television etc, it is changed so that it can be made into a film, television programme etc
example[6]: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
explanation[0]: Adapt is usually passive in this meaning
